required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Endovascular Graft Anchoring Different Regions of Ascending Aorta in the Treatment of Ascending Aortic Dissection
clinical_study.official_title: Endovascular Graft Anchoring Different Regions of Ascending Aorta in the Treatment of Ascending Aortic Dissection: a Prospective， Controlled and Multicenter Study

brief_summary.textblock: Aortic dissection is a deadly and dangerous disease. About 28% of patients with ascending aortic dissection can't tolerate open surgical trauma caused by thoracotomy and cardiopulmonary bypass, and the prognosis is poor. Minimally invasive endovascular treatment has been applied in the treatment of descending aortic dissection. However, due to the special anatomical structure and high speed /pressure blood flow, the treatment of ascending aorta dissection has become an international difficulty.

detailed_description.textblock: This study was designed combination of retrospective and prospective methods, and focused on distal false lumen Aneurysmal Expansion of Aortic Dissection (DAEAD) . To formulate clinical data for the risk assessment of DAEAD, and best intracavitary treatment or long-term efficacy evaluation, we combined the results of genetic testing, evaluating the missense mutation, computer simulation of blood flow dynamics analysis, and clinical imaging analysis.

primary_outcome.description: The operation was completed successfully without complications.

intervention.intervention_name: Stent grafts anchored in different areas
intervention.description: Endovascular repair of ascending aortic dissection patients with stent grafts anchored in different areas

study_pop.textblock: This clinical trial included a prospective study of patients admitted to the hospital with aortic dissection between October 2020 and September 2023 who were treated with an endoluminal graft after exclusion of surgical contraindications.
